attributes.action: Deprive the euro in campaign of £7m to help level the debate.
attributes.background: Over £9m of our money was used to try to persuade voters to stay in the EU. We believe that the in campaign should NOT be given their allocated £7m. The £9m already spent should be considered an overspend of £2m. Every effort should be made to get this back to the public purse.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The UK Government and Parliament does not have the power to deprive any referendum campaign of money. What the Government is permitted to do is set out in the European Union Referendum Act 2015 and the Political Parties, Elections and Referendums Act 2000.
